Note that if you use the Blocks or OnBot Java Tool to program your robot, then you do not need to download this repository.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf you are a git user, you can clone the most current version of the repository:\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003egit clone \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController.git\"\u003ehttps://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController.git\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eOr, if you prefer, you can use the \"Download Zip\" button available through the main repository page.  Downloading the project as a .ZIP file will keep the size of the download manageable.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou can also download the project folder (as a .zip or .tar.gz archive file) from the Downloads subsection of the \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/releases\"\u003eReleases\u003c/a\u003e page for this repository.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe Releases page also contains prebuilt APKs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ecable\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds ConceptLEDStick OpMode\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Blocks for colors black, blue, cyan, dkgray, gray, green, ltgray, magenta, red, white, and yellow.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds an \"evaluate but ignore result\" Block that executes the connected block and ignores the result. Allows you to call a function and ignore the return value.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds I2C driver for Maxbotix Maxsonar I2CXL sonar rangefinder\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Blocks for setPwmEnable, setPwmDisable, and isPwmEnabled for servos and CR servos.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIn the Blocks editor: a \\n in the ExportToBlocks annotation's comment field is displayed as a line break.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTelemetry has new method setNumDecimalPlaces\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTelemetry now formats doubles and floats (not inside objects, just by themselves)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for the Limelight 3A.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds initial support for the REV Servo Hub\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBoth the Robot Controller and Driver Station need to be updated to version 10.0 in order for Servo Hubs to be\nconfigurable as Servo Hubs. If the app on either device is outdated, the Servo Hub will show up as an Expansion Hub,\nand some functionality will not work as expected. You should wait to create a configuration that includes a Servo Hub\nuntil both the Driver Station and Robot Controller apps have been updated to version 10.0.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdating the Servo Hub's firmware and changing its address can only be done using the REV Hardware Client at this time\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for the REV 9-Axis IMU (REV-31-3332)\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe REV 9-Axis IMU is only supported by the \u003ca href=\"https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/en/latest/programming_resources/imu/imu.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eUniversal IMU interface\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds \u003ccode\u003eRev9AxisImuOrientationOnRobot\u003c/code\u003e Java class.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf you mentally substitute this IMU's I2C port for the Control Hub's USB ports, \u003ccode\u003eRevHubOrientationOnRobot\u003c/code\u003e is also compatible with this sensor\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Blocks for Rev9AxisImuOrientationOnRobot, including RevHubImuOrientationOnRobot.xyzOrientation and  RevHubImuOrientationOnRobot.zyxOrientation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Blocks samples SensorRev9AxisIMUOrthogonal and SensorRev9AxisIMUNonOrthogonal.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves Blocks support for RevHubImuOrientationOnRobot.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Blocks for RevHubImuOrientationOnRobot.xyzOrientation and  RevHubImuOrientationOnRobot.zyxOrientation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Blocks samples SensorHubIMUOrthogonal (replaces SensorIMU) and SensorHubIMUNonOrthogonal.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdates EasyOpenCV, AprilTag, OpenCV, and \u003ccode\u003elibjpeg-turbo\u003c/code\u003e versions\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Blocks for max and min that take two numbers.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Blocks OpModes ConceptRevSPARKMini, RobotAutoDriveByEncoder, RobotAutoDriveByGyro, RobotAutoDriveByTime, RobotAutoDriveToAprilTagOmni, and RobotAutoDriveToAprilTagTank.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTwo OpModes with the same name now automatically get renamed with the name followed by a \"-\" and the class name allowing them to both be on the device.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eShows the name of the active configuration on the Manage page of the Robot Controller Console\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdated AprilTag Library for INTO THE DEEP. Notably, \u003ccode\u003egetCurrentGameTagLibrary()\u003c/code\u003e now returns INTO THE DEEP tags.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Blocks for Telemetry.setMsTransmissionInterval and Telemetry.getMsTransmissionInterval.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Blocks sample SensorOctoQuad.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eBug Fixes\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-bug-fixes\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Bug Fixes\" href=\"#bug-fixes\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes a bug where the RevBlinkinLedDriver Blocks were under Actuators in the Blocks editor toolbox. To view the explanatory text tap the red warning icon for a failed item.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIn the Blocks editor: added a new kind of variable set block that sets the variable and also returns the new value.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChanges the way that camera controls behave for a SwitchableCamera. Now, each method (such as getExposure, getMinExposure, getMaxExposure, setExposure for ExposureControl) acts on the currently active camera.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for the REV USB PS4 Compatible Gamepad (REV-31-2983)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds ConceptAprilTagMultiPortal OpMode\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for OctoQuad Quadrature Encoder \u0026amp; Pulse Width Interface Module\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds the ExportAprilTagLibraryToBlocks annotation that indicates that a static method that returns an AprilTagLibrary is exported to the Blocks programming environment. The corresponding block will appear in the Blocks toolbox along with the built-in tag libraries.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Blocks OpMode ConceptAprilTagOptimizeExposure.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for the SparkFun Optical Tracking Odometry sensor.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" closes a Block's warning balloon, it will still be closed next time the project is opened in the Blocks editor.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIn the Blocks editor, an alert concerning missing hardware devices is not shown if all the Blocks that use the missing hardware devices are disabled.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Blocks to support comparing property values CRServo.Direction, DCMotor.Direction, DCMotor.Mode, DCMotor.ZeroPowerBehavior, DigitalChannel.Mode, GyroSensor.HeadingMode, IrSeekerSensor.Mode, and Servo.Direction, to the corresponding enum Block.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves OnBotJava auto-import to correctly import classes when used in certain situations.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves OnBotJava autocomplete to provide better completion options in most cases.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThis fixes an issue where autocomplete would fail if a method with two or more formal parameters was defined.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIn OnBotJava, code folding support was added to expand and collapse code sections\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIn OnBotJava, the copyright header is now automatically collapsed loading new files\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFor all Blocks OpMode samples, intro comments have been moved to the RunOpMode comment balloon.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe Clean up Blocks command in the Blocks editor now positions function Blocks so their comment balloons don't overlap other function Blocks.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded Blocks OpMode sample SensorTouch.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded Java OpMode sample SensorDigitalTouch.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSeveral improvements to VisionPortal\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds option to control whether the stream is automatically started following a \u003ccode\u003e.build()\u003c/code\u003e call on a VisionPortal Builder\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds option to control whether the vision processing statistics overlay is rendered or not\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eVisionPortals now implement the \u003ccode\u003eCameraStreamSource\u003c/code\u003e interface, allowing multiportal users to select which portal is routed to the DS in INIT by calling CameraStreamServer.getInstance().setSource(visionPortal). Can be selected via gamepad, between Camera Stream sessions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd option to \u003ccode\u003eAprilTagProcessor\u003c/code\u003e to suppress calibration warnings\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves camera calibration warnings\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf a calibration is scaled, the resolution it was scaled from will be listed\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf calibrations exist with the wrong aspect ratio, the calibrated resolutions will be listed\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes race condition which caused app crash when calling \u003ccode\u003estopStreaming()\u003c/code\u003e immediately followed by \u003ccode\u003eclose()\u003c/code\u003e on a VisionPortal\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes IllegalStateException when calling \u003ccode\u003estopStreaming()\u003c/code\u003e immediately after building a VisionPortal\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded FTC Blocks counterparts to new Java methods:\n\u003cul Vision Sensor.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBlocks teams can now perform webcam calibration.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded a Block for System.currentTimeMillis (under Utilities/Time)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded a Block for VisionPortal.saveNextFrameRaw (under Vision/VisionPortal)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded a new sample Blocks OpMode called UtilityCameraFrameCapture.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe RobotDriveByGyro sample has been updated to use the new universal IMU interface.  It now supports both IMU types.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoved some error-prone ElapsedTime Blocks from the Blocks editor's toolbox. This is not a\nbreaking change: old Blocks OpModes that use these Blocks will still function, both in the\nBlocks editor and at runtime.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eStandardizes on the form \"OpMode\" for the term OpMode.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe preferred way to refer to OpModes that specifically extend \u003ccode\u003eLinearOpMode\u003c/code\u003e (including Blocks OpModes) is \"linear OpMode\".\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe preferred way to refer to OpModes that specifically extend \u003ccode\u003eOpMode\u003c/code\u003e directly is \"iterative OpMode\".\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOverhauls \u003ccode\u003eOpMode\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eLinearOpMode\u003c/code\u003e Javadoc comments to be easier to read and include more detail.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMakes minor enhancements to Java samples\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eJavadoc comments in samples that could be rendered badly in Android Studio have been converted to standard multi-line comments\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eConsistency between samples has been improved\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe SensorDigitalTouch sample has been replaced with a new SensorTouch sample that uses the \u003ccode\u003eTouchSensor\u003c/code\u003e interface instead of \u003ccode\u003eDigitalChannel\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe ConceptCompassCalibration, SensorMRCompass, and SensorMRIRSeeker samples have been deleted, as they are not useful for modern FTC competitions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" which prevented PlayStation gamepads from being used in bluetooth mode. Bluetooth is NOT legal for competition but may be useful to allow a DS device to be used while charging, or at an outreach event.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes a bug where a Blocks OpMode's Date Modified value can change to December 31, 1969, if the Control Hub is rebooted while the Blocks OpMode is being edited.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes the automatic TeleOp preselection feature (was broken in 8.2)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes a bug where passing an integer number such as 123 to the Telemetry.addData block that takes a number shows up as 123.0 in the telemetry.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes OnBotJava autocomplete issues:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAutocomplete would incorrectly provide values for the current class when autocompleting a local variable\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ehardwareMap\u003c/code\u003e autocomplete would incorrectly include lambda class entries\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes OnBotJava not automatically importing classes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes OnBotJava tabs failing to close when their file is deleted.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes a project view refresh not happening when a file is renamed in OnBotJava.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes the \"Download\" context menu item for external libraries in the OnBotJava interface.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes issue where Driver Station telemetry would intermittently freeze when set to Monospace mode.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes performance regression for certain REV Hub operations that was introduced in version 8.2.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes TagID comparison logic in (iterative) OpModes are no longer allowed to manipulate actuators in their \u003ccode\u003estop()\u003c/code\u003e method. Attempts to do so will be ignored and logged.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eWhen an OpMode attempts to illegally manipulate an actuator, the Robot Controller will print a log message\nincluding the text \u003ccode\u003eCANCELLED_FOR_SAFETY\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdditionally, LinearOpModes are no longer able to regain the ability to manipulate actuators by removing their\nthread's interrupt or using another thread.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoves support for Android version 6.0 (Marshmallow). The minSdkVersion is now 24.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIncreases the Robocol version.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThis means an 8.2 or later Robot Controller or Driver Station will not be able to communicate with an 8.1 or earlier Driver Station or Robot Controller.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf you forget to update both apps at the same time, an error message will be shown explaining which app is older and should be updated.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFTC_FieldCoordinateSystemDefinition.pdf has been moved.  It is still in the git history, but has been removed from the git snapshot corresponding with the 8.2 tag.  The official version now lives at \u003ca href=\"https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/field-coordinate-system\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eField Coordinate System\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eLynxUsbDevice.addConfiguredModule()\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eLynxUsbDevice.getConfiguredModule()\u003c/code\u003e have been replaced with \u003ccode\u003eLynxUsbDevice.getOrAddModule()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOld Blocks for Vuforia and TensorFlow Object Detection are obsolete and have been removed from the\nBlocks editor's toolbox. Existing Blocks OpModes that contain the old Blocks for Vuforia or\nTensorFlow Object Detection can be opened in the Blocks editor, but running them will not work.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eNew features\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca vision\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThis API may be subject to change for final kickoff release!\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSeveral new samples added.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for detecting AprilTags.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eVisionPortal\u003c/code\u003e is the new entry point for both AprilTag and TFOD processing.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eVuforia will be removed in a future release.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdated TensorFlow dependencies.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded support for webcam camera controls to blocks.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe Blocks editor's toolbox now has a Vision category, directly above the Utilities category.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRelated documentation for associated technologies can be found at\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/apriltag-intro\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eAprilTag Introduction\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/apriltag-sdk\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eAprilTag SDK Guide\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/apriltag-detection-values\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eAprilTag Detection Values\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/apriltag-test-images\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eAprilTag Test Images\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/camera-calibration\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eCamera Calibration\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Driver Station support for Logitech Dual Action and Sony PS5 DualSense gamepads.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThis \u003cstrong\u003edoes not\u003c/strong\u003e include support for the Sony PS5 DualSense Edge gamepad.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAlways refer to Game Manual 1 to determine gamepad legality in competition.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for MJPEG payload streaming to UVC driver (external JPEG decompression routine required for use).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eShows a hint on the Driver Station UI about how to bind a gamepad when buttons are pressed or the sticks are moved on an unbound gamepad.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds option for fullscreening \"Camera Stream\" on Driver Station.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOnBotJava source code is automatically saved as a ZIP file on every build with a rolling window of the last 30 builds kept; allows recovering source code from previous builds if code is accidentally deleted or corrupted.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for changing the addresses of Expansion Hubs that are not connected directly via USB.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe Expansion Hub Address Change screen now has an Apply button that changes the addresses without leaving the screen.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAddresses that are assigned to other hubs connected to the same USB connection or Control Hub are no longer able to be selected.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIncreases maximum size of Blocks inline comments to 100 characters\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSaves position of open Blocks comment balloons\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds new AprilTag Driving samples:  RobotDriveToAprilTagTank \u0026amp; RobotDriveToAprilTagOmni\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Sample to illustrate optimizing camera exposure for AprilTags: ConceptAprilTagOptimizeExposure\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" inspection screen to report app version using the SDK version defined in the libraries instead of the version specified in \u003ccode\u003eAndroidManifest.xml\u003c/code\u003e. This corrects the case where the app could show matching versions numbers to the user but still state that the versions did not match.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf the version specified in \u003ccode\u003eAndroidManifest.xml\u003c/code\u003e does not match the SDK version, an SDK version entry will be displayed on the Manage webpage.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes no error being displayed when saving a configuration file with duplicate names from the Driver Station.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes a deadlock in the UVC driver which manifested in \u003ca class=\"issue-link js-issue-link\" data-error-text=\"Failed to load title\" data-id=\"1460450912\" data-permission-text=\"Title is private\" data-url=\"https://github.com/OpenFTC/EasyOpenCV/issues/57\" data-hovercard-type=\"issue\" data-hovercard-url=\"/OpenFTC/EasyOpenCV/issues/57/hovercard\" href=\"https://github.com/OpenFTC/EasyOpenCV/issues/57\"\u003eOpenFTC/EasyOpenCV#57\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes a deadlock in the UVC driver that could occur when hot-plugging cameras.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes UVC driver compatibility with Arducam OV9281 global shutter camera.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes Emergency Stop condition when an OnBotJava build with duplicate OpMode names occurs.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes known causes of \"Attempted use of a closed LynxModule instance\" logspam.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes the visual identification LED pattern when configuring Expansion Hubs connected via RS-485.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" the \u003ccode\u003eOpMode\u003c/code\u003e fields \u003ccode\u003emsStuckDetectInit\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003emsStuckDetectInitLoop\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003emsStuckDetectStart\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003emsStuckDetectLoop\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003emsStuckDetectStop\u003c/code\u003e.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOpModes no longer have a time limit for \u003ccode\u003einit()\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003einit_loop()\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003estart()\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003eloop()\u003c/code\u003e, so the fields corresponding to those methods are no longer used.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003estop()\u003c/code\u003e still has a time limit, but it is now hardcoded to be 1 second, and cannot be changed using \u003ccode\u003emsStuckDetectStop\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecates the \u003ccode\u003eOpMode\u003c/code\u003e methods \u003ccode\u003einternalPreInit()\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003einternalPostInitLoop()\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003einternalPostLoop()\u003c/code\u003e.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIterative \u003ccode\u003eOpMode\u003c/code\u003es will continue to call these methods in case they were overridden.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThese methods will not be called at all for \u003ccode\u003eLinearOpMode\u003c/code\u003es.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecates (and stops respecting) dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds a new \u003ccode\u003eIMU\u003c/code\u003e interface to Blocks and Java that can be used with both the original BNO055 IMU\nincluded in all older Control Hubs and Expansion Hubs, and the new alternative BHI260AP IMU.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eYou can determine which type of IMU is in your Control Hub by navigating to the Manage page of the web interface.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTo learn how to use the new \u003ccode\u003eIMU\u003c/code\u003e interface, see \u003ca href=\"https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/programming_resources/imu/imu.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ehttps://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/programming_resources/imu/imu.html\u003c/a\u003e. The \u003ccode\u003eSensorIMU\u003c/code\u003e Blocks sample was also updated to use the new \u003ccode\u003eIMU\u003c/code\u003e interface, and the following Java samples were added:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eSensorIMUOrthogonal\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUse this sample if your REV Hub is mounted so that it is parallel or perpendicular to the\nbottom of your robot.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eSensorIMUNonOrthogonal\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUse this sample if your REV Hub is mounted to your robot in any other orientation\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eConceptExploringIMUOrientations\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThis OpMode is a tool to help you understand how the orthogonal orientations work, and\nwhich one applies to your robot.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe BHI260AP IMU can only be accessed via the new \u003ccode\u003eIMU\u003c/code\u003e interface. The BNO055 IMU can be\nprogrammed using the new \u003ccode\u003eIMU\u003c/code\u003e interface, or you can continue to program it using the old \u003ccode\u003eBNO055IMU\u003c/code\u003e\ninterface. If you want to be able to quickly switch to a new Control Hub that may contain the\nBHI260AP IMU, you should migrate your code to use the new \u003ccode\u003eIMU\u003c/code\u003e interface.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUnlike the old \u003ccode\u003eBNO055IMU\u003c/code\u003e interface, which only worked correctly when the REV Hub was mounted flat\non your robot, the \u003ccode\u003eIMU\u003c/code\u003e interface allows you to specify the orientation of the REV Hub on your\nrobot. It will account for this, and give you your orientation in a Robot Coordinate System,\ninstead of a special coordinate system for the REV Hub. As a result, your pitch and yaw will be\n0 when your \u003cem\u003erobot\u003c/em\u003e is level, instead of when the REV Hub is level, which will result in much\nmore reliable orientation angle values for most mounting orientations.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBecause of the new robot-centric coordinate system, the pitch and roll angles returned by the\n\u003ccode\u003eIMU\u003c/code\u003e interface will be different from the ones returned by the \u003ccode\u003eBNO055IMU\u003c/code\u003e interface. When you are\nmigrating your code, pay careful attention to the documentation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf you have calibrated your BNO055, you can provide that calibration data to the new \u003ccode\u003eIMU\u003c/code\u003e\ninterface by passing a \u003ccode\u003eBNO055IMUNew.Parameters\u003c/code\u003e instance to \u003ccode\u003eIMU.initialize()\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eIMU\u003c/code\u003e interface is also suitable for implementation by third-party vendors for IMUs that\nsupport providing the orientation in the form of a quaternion.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIterative \u003ccode\u003eOpMode\u003c/code\u003es (as opposed to \u003ccode\u003eLinearOpMode\u003c/code\u003es) now run on a dedicated thread.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCycle times should not be as impacted by everything else going on in the system.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSlow \u003ccode\u003eOpMode\u003c/code\u003es can no longer increase the amount of time it takes to process network commands, and vice versa.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003einit()\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003einit_loop()\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003estart()\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eloop()\u003c/code\u003e methods no longer need to return within a certain time frame.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBNO055 IMU legacy driver: restores the ability to initialize in one OpMode, and then have another OpMode re-use that\ninitialization. This allows you to maintain the 0-yaw position between OpModes, if desired.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllows customized versions of device drivers in the FTC SDK to use the same XML tag.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBefore, if you wanted to customize a device driver, you had to copy it to a new class \u003cem\u003eand\u003c/em\u003e give\nit a new XML tag. Giving it a new XML tag meant that to switch which driver was being used, you\nhad to modify your configuration file.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNow, to use your custom driver, all you have to do is specify your custom driver's class when\ncalling \u003ccode\u003ehardwareMap.get()\u003c/code\u003e. To go back to the original driver, specify the original driver\nclass. If you specify an interface that is implemented by both the original driver and the\ncustom driver, there is no guarantee about which implementation will be returned.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIncreases the Robocol version.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThis means an 8.0 or later Robot Controller or Driver Station will not be able to communicate with a 7.2 or earlier Driver Station or Robot Controller.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf you forget to update both apps at the same time, an error message will be shown explaining which app is older and should be updated.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eInitializing I2C devices now happens when you retrieve them from the \u003ccode\u003eHardwareMap\u003c/code\u003e for the first time.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePreviously, all I2C devices would be initialized before the OpMode even began executing,\nwhether you were actually going to use them or not. This could result in reduced performance and\nunnecessary warnings.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eWith this change, it is very important for Java users to retrieve all needed devices from the\n\u003ccode\u003eHardwareMap\u003c/code\u003e \u003cstrong\u003eduring the Init phase of the OpMode\u003c/strong\u003e. Namely, declare a variable for each hardware\ndevice the OpMode will use, and assign a value to each. Do not do this during the Run phase, or your\nOpMode may briefly hang while the devices you are retrieving get initialized.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOpModes that do not use all of the I2C devices specified in the configuration file should take\nless time to initialize. OpModes that do use all of the specified I2C devices should take the\nsame amount of time as previously.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/251\" data-hovercard-type=\"issue\" data-hovercard-url=\"/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/251/hovercard\"\u003eissue #251\u003c/a\u003e by changing the order in which axis rotation rates are read from the angular velocity vector in the BNO055 IMU driver.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeprecates \u003ccode\u003epitchMode\u003c/code\u003e in \u003ccode\u003eBNO055IMU.Parameters\u003c/code\u003e.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSetting \u003ccode\u003epitchMode\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003ePitchMode.WINDOWS\u003c/code\u003e would break the coordinate conventions used by the driver.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMoves \u003ccode\u003eOpModeManagerImpl\u003c/code\u003e to the \u003ccode\u003ecom.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode\u003c/code\u003e package.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThis breaks third party libraries EasyOpenCV (version 1.5.1 and earlier) and FTC Dashboard (version 0.4.4 and earlier).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeletes the deprecated \u003ccode\u003eOpMode\u003c/code\u003e method \u003ccode\u003eresetStartTime()\u003c/code\u003e (use \u003ccode\u003eresetRuntime()\u003c/code\u003e instead).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDeletes the protected \u003ccode\u003eLinearOpMode.LinearOpModeHelper\u003c/code\u003e class (which was not meant for use by OpModes).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoves I2C Device (Synchronous) config type (deprecated since 2018)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eEnhancements\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-enhancements-6\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Enhancements\" href=\"#enhancements-6\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUncaught exceptions in OpModes no longer require a Restart Robot\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eA blue screen popping up with a stacktrace is not an SDK error; this replaces the red text in the telemetry area.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSince the very first SDK release, OpMode crashes have put the robot into \"EMERGENCY STOP\" state, only showing the first line of the exception, and requiring the user to press \"Restart Robot\" to continue\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExceptions during an OpMode now open a popup window with the same color scheme as the log viewer, containing 15 lines of the exception stacktrace to allow easily tracing down the offending line without needing to connect to view logs over ADB or scroll through large amounts of logs in the log viewer.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe exception text in the popup window is both zoomable and scrollable just like a webpage.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePressing the \"OK\" button in the popup window will return to the main screen of the Driver Station and allow an OpMode to be run again immediately, without the need to perform a \"Restart Robot\"\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds new Java sample to demonstrate using a hardware class to abstract robot actuators, and share them across multiple OpModes.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSample OpMode is \u003ca href=\"/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/blob/master/FtcRobotController/src/main/java/org/firstinspires/ftc/robotcontroller/external/samples/ConceptExternalHardwareClass.java\"\u003eConceptExternalHardwareClass.java\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAbstracted hardware class is \u003ca href=\"/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/blob/master/FtcRobotController/src/main/java/org/firstinspires/ftc/robotcontroller/external/samples/RobotHardware.java\"\u003eRobotHardware.java\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdates RobotAutoDriveByGyro_Linear Java sample to use REV Control/Expansion hub IMU.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdates Vuforia samples to reference PowerPlay assets and have correct names and field locations of image targets.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdates TensorFlow samples to reference PowerPlay assets.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds opt-in support for Java 8 language features to the OnBotJava editor.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTo opt in, open the OnBotJava Settings, and check \u003ccode\u003eEnable beta Java 8 support\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNote that Java 8 code will only compile when the Robot Controller runs Android 7.0 Nougat or later.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePlease report issues \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIn OnBotJava, clicking on build errors now correctly jumps to the correct location.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves OnBotJava autocomplete behavior, to provide better completion options in most cases.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds a QR code to the Robot Controller Inspection Report when viewed from the Driver Station for scanning by inspectors at competition.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves I2C performance and reliability in some scenarios.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 build tooling.  For Android Studio users, this change requires Android Studio Chipmunk 2021.2.1.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoves support for devices that are not competition legal, including Modern Robotics Core Control Modules, the Matrix Controller, and HiTechnic/NXT controllers and sensors.  Support remains for Modern Robotics I2C sensors.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eEnhancements\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-enhancements-7\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Enhancements\" href=\"#enhancements-7\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIncreases the height of the 3-dots Landscape menu touch area on the Driver Station, making it much easier to select.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds \u003ccode\u003eterminateOpModeNow()\u003c/code\u003e method to allow OpModes to cleanly self-exit immediately.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds \u003ccode\u003eopModeInInit()\u003c/code\u003e method to \u003ccode\u003eLinearOpMode\u003c/code\u003e to facilitate init-loops. Similar to \u003ccode\u003eopModeIsActive()\u003c/code\u003e but for the init phase.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eWarns user if they have a Logitech F310 gamepad connected that is set to DirectInput mode.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllows SPARKmini motor controllers to react more quickly to speed changes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHides the version number of incorrectly installed sister app (i.e. DS installed on RC device or vice-versa) on inspection screen.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for allowing the user to edit the comment for the runOpMode block.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds parameterDefaultValues field to @ExportToBlocks. This provides the ability for a java method with an @ExportToBlocks annotation to specify default values for method parameters when it is shown in the block editor.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMake LinearOpMode blocks more readable. The opmode name is displayed on the runOpMode block, but not on the other LinearOpMode blocks.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded support to TensorFlow Object Detection for using a different frame generator, instead of Vuforia.\nUsing Vuforia to pass the camera frame to TFOD is still supported.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoves usage of Renderscript.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes logspam on app startup of repeated stacktraces relating to \u003ccode\u003e\"Failed resolution of: Landroid/net/wifi/p2p/WifiP2pManager$DeviceInfoListener\"\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllows disabling bluetooth radio from inspection screen\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves warning messages when I2C devices are not responding\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for controlling the RGB LED present on PS4/Etpark gamepads from OpModes\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoves legacy Pushbot references from OpMode samples.  Renames \"Pushbot\" samples to \"Robot\".  Motor directions reversed to be compatible with \"direct Drive\" drive train.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" href=\"https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/316\" data-hovercard-type=\"issue\" data-hovercard-url=\"/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/316/hovercard\"\u003eissue #316\u003c/a\u003e (MatrixF.inverted() returned an incorrectly-sized matrix for 1x1 and 2x2 matrixes).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSelf inspect now allows for Driver Station and Robot Controller compatibility between point releases.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes bug where if the same \u003ccode\u003eRumbleEffect\u003c/code\u003e object instance was queued for multiple gamepads, it\ncould happen that both rumble commands would be sent to just one gamepad.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes bug in Driver Station where on the Driver Hub, if Advanced Gamepad Features was disabled and\nan officially supported gamepad was connected, then opening the Advanced Gamepad Features or\nGamepad Type Overrides screens would cause the gamepad to be rebound by the custom USB driver even\nthough advanced gamepad features was disabled.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eProtects against (unlikely) null pointer exception in Vuforia Localizer.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHarden OnBotJava and Blocks saves to protect against save issues when disconnecting from Program and Manage\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes issue where the RC app would hang if a REV Hub I2C write failed because the previous I2C\noperation was still in progress. This hang most commonly occurred during REV 2M Distance Sensor initialization\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoves ConceptWebcam.java sample program.  This sample is not compatible with OnBotJava.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes bug where using html tags in an @ExportToBlocks comment field prevented the blocks editor from loading.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes blocks editor so it doesn't ask you to save when you haven't modified anything.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes uploading a very large blocks project to offline blocks editor.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes bug that caused blocks for DcMotorEx to be omitted from the blocks editor toolbox.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes \u003ca href=\"https://ftcforum.firstinspires.org/forum/ftc-technology/blocks-programming/87035-blocks-programs-stripped-of-blocks\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eBlocks Programs Stripped of Blocks (due to using TensorFlow Label block)\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" href=\"https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/4\" data-hovercard-type=\"issue\" data-hovercard-url=\"/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/4/hovercard\"\u003eissue #4\u003c/a\u003e).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes Driver Station crash when attempting to use DualShock4 v1 gamepad with Advanced Gamepad Features enabled (\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/173\" data-hovercard-type=\"issue\" data-hovercard-url=\"/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/173/hovercard\"\u003eissue #173\u003c/a\u003e).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes possible (but unlikely) Driver Station crash when connecting gamepads of any type.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes bug where Driver Station would use generic 20% deadzone for Xbox360 and Logitech F310 gamepads when Advanced Gamepad Features was disabled.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded SimpleOmniDrive sample OpMode.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds UVC white balance control API.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/259\" data-hovercard-type=\"issue\" data-hovercard-url=\"/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/259/hovercard\"\u003eissue #259\u003c/a\u003e Most blocks samples for TensorFlow can't be used for a different model.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe blocks previously labeled TensorFlowObjectDetectionFreightFrenzy (from the subcategory named \"Optimized for Freight Frenzy\") and TensorFlowObjectDetectionCustomModel (from the subcategory named \"Custom Model\") have been replaced with blocks labeled TensorFlowObjectDetection. Blocks in existing opmodes will be automatically updated to the new blocks when opened in the blocks editor.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/260\" data-hovercard-type=\"issue\" data-hovercard-url=\"/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/260/hovercard\"\u003eissue #260\u003c/a\u003e Blocks can't call java method that has a VuforiaLocalizer parameter.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBlocks now has a block labeled VuforiaFreightFrenzy.getVuforiaLocalizer for this.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded a page to manage the TensorFlow Lite models in /sdcard/FIRST/tflitemodels. To get to the TFLite Models page:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eYou can click on the link at the bottom of the the Manage page.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eYou can click on the link at the upper-right the Blocks project page.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes logspam when \u003ccode\u003eisBusy()\u003c/code\u003e is called on a motor not in RTP mode.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHides the \"RC Password\" item on the inspection screen for phone-based Robot Controllers. (It is only applicable for Control Hubs).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds channel 165 to Wi-Fi Direct channel selection menu in the settings screen. (165 was previously available through the web UI, but not locally in the app).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eEnhancements and New Features\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-enhancements-and-new-features\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Enhancements and New Features\" href=\"#enhancements-and-new-features\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for external libraries to OnBotJava and Blocks.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpload .jar and .aar files in OnBotJava.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eKnown limitation - RobotController device must be running Android 7.0 or greater.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eKnown limitation - .aar files with assets are not supported.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExternal libraries can provide support for hardware devices by using the annotation in the\ncom.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.configuration.annotations package.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExternal libraries can include .so files for native code.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExternal libraries can be used from OnBotJava OpModes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExternal libraries that use the following annotations can be used from Blocks OpModes.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eorg.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.ExportClassToBlocks\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eorg.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.ExportToBlocks\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExternal libraries that use the following annotations can add new hardware devices:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ecom.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.configuration.annotations.AnalogSensorType\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ecom.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.configuration.annotations.DeviceProperties\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ecom.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.configuration.annotations.DigitalIoDeviceType\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ecom.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.configuration.annotations.I2cDeviceType\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ecom.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.configuration.annotations.MotorType\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ecom.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.configuration.annotations.ServoType\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExternal libraries that use the following annotations can add new functionality to the Robot Controller:\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eorg.firstinspires.ftc.ftccommon.external.OnCreate\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eorg.firstinspires.ftc.ftccommon.external.OnCreateEventLoop\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eorg.firstinspires.ftc.ftccommon.external.OnCreateMenu\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eorg.firstinspires.ftc.ftccommon.external.OnDestroy\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eorg.firstinspires.ftc.ftccommon.external.WebHandlerRegistrar\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for REV Robotics Driver Hub.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds fully custom userspace USB gamepad driver to Driver Station (see \"Advanced Gamepad Features\" menu in DS settings).\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllows gamepads to work on devices without native Linux kernel support (e.g. some Romanian Motorola devices).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllows the DS to read the unique serial number of each gamepad, enabling auto-recovery of dropped gamepads even if two gamepads of the same model drop. \u003cem\u003e(NOTE: unfortunately this does not apply to Etpark gamepads, because they do not have a unique serial)\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eReading the unique serial number also provides the ability to configure the DS to assign gamepads to a certain position by default (so no need to do start+a/b at all).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe LED ring on the Xbox360 gamepad and the RGB LED bar on the PS4 gamepad is used to indicate the driver position the gamepad is bound to.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe rumble motors on the Xbox360, PS4, and Etpark gamepads can be controlled from OpModes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe 2-point touchpad on the PS4 gamepad can be read from OpModes.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe \"back\" and \"guide\" buttons on the gamepad can now be safely bound to robot controls (Previously, on many devices, Android would intercept these buttons as home button presses and close the app).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdvanced Gamepad features are enabled by default, but may be disabled through the settings menu in order to revert to gamepad support provided natively by Android.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves accuracy of ping measurement.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes issue where the ping time showed as being higher than reality when initially connecting to or restarting the robot.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTo see the full improvement, you must update both the Robot Controller and Driver Station apps.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdates samples located at \u003ca href=\"/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/blob/master/FtcRobotController/src/main/java/org/firstinspires/ftc/robotcontroller/external/samples\"\u003e/FtcRobotController/src/main/java/org/firstinspires/ftc/robotcontroller/external/samples\u003c/a\u003e.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded ConceptGamepadRumble and ConceptGamepadTouchpad samples to illustrate the use of these new gampad capabilities.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCondensed existing Vuforia samples into just 2 samples (ConceptVuforiaFieldNavigation \u0026amp; ConceptVuforiaFieldNavigationWebcam) showing how to determine the robot's location on the field using Vuforia. These both use the current season's Target images.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdded ConceptVuforiaDriveToTargetWebcam to illustrate an easy way to drive directly to any visible Vuforia target.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMakes many improvements to the warning system and individual warnings.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eWarnings are now much more spaced out, so that they are easier to read.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew warnings were added for conditions that should be resolved before competing.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe mismatched apps warning now uses the major and minor app versions, not the version code.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe warnings are automatically re-enabled when a Robot Controller app from a new FTC season is installed.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for I2C transactions on the Expansion Hub / Control Hub without specifying a register address.\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSee section 3 of the \u003ca href=\"https://www.ti.com/lit/an/slva704/slva704.pdf\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eTI I2C spec\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCalling these new methods when using Modern Robotics hardware will result in an UnsupportedOperationException.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eChanges VuforiaLocalizer \u003ccode\u003eclose()\u003c/code\u003e method to be public.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for TensorFlow v2 object detection models.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eReduces ambiguity of the Self Inspect language and graphics.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOnBotJava now warns about potentially unintended file overwrites.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves behavior of the Wi-Fi band and channel selector on the Manage webpage.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eBug especially in landscape mode\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMakes the Robot Controller service no longer be categorically restarted when the main activity is brought to foreground\n\u003cul Play\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes issue where the Control Hub OS's watchdog would restart the Robot Controller app if\nthe Control Hub was not able to communicate with its internal Expansion Hub\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes certain I2C devices not showing up in the appropriate \u003ccode\u003eHardwareMap\u003c/code\u003e fields (such as \u003ccode\u003ehardwareMap.colorSensor\u003c/code\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes issue where performing a Wi-Fi factory reset on the Control Hub would not set the Wi-Fi band to 2.4 GHz\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes issue where OnBotJava might fail to create a new file if the option to \"Setup Code for Configured Hardware\" was selected\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes issue where performing certain operations after an OpMode crashes would temporarily break Control/Expansion Hub communication\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes issue where a Control Hub with a configured USB-connected Expansion Hub would not work if the Expansion Hub was missing at startup\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes potential issues caused by having mismatched Control/Expansion Hub firmware versions\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/ftctechnh/ftc_app/issues/673\" data-hovercard-type=\"issue\" data-hovercard-url=\"/ftctechnh/ftc_app/issues/673/hovercard\"\u003eftc_app issue 673\u003c/a\u003e Latest matchlog is being deleted instead of old ones by RobotLog\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes ConceptVuforiaUltimateGoalNavigationWebcam sample opmode by correctly orienting camera on robot.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes issue where logcat would be spammed with InterruptedExceptions when stop is requested from the Driver Station (this behavior was accidentally introduced in v5.3). This change has no impact on functionality.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes issue where the blocks editor fails to load if the name of any TeleOp opmode contains an apostrophe.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eVersion 6.1 Hubs connected via RS-485\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/SkyStone/issues/143\" data-hovercard-type=\"issue\" data-hovercard-url=\"/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/SkyStone/issues/143/hovercard\"\u003eSkyStone issue #143\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves web interface compatibility with older browser and Android System WebView versions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes issue in UVC driver where some cameras (e.g. certain MS Lifecams) which reported frame intervals as rounded rather than truncated values (e.g. \u003ccode\u003e666667*100ns\u003c/code\u003e instead of \u003ccode\u003e666666*100ns\u003c/code\u003e for 15FPS) would fail to start streaming.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support in UVC driver for virtual PTZ control\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support in UVC driver for gain (ISO) control\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support in UVC driver for enabling/disable AE priority. This setting provides a means to tell the camera firmware either\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eA) It can undershoot the requested frame rate in order to provide a theoretically better image (i.e. with a longer exposure than the inter-frame period of the selected frame rate allows)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eB) It \u003cem\u003emust\u003c/em\u003e meet the inter-frame deadline for the selected frame rate, even if the image may be underexposed as a result\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for the Control Hub OS 1.1.2 Robot Controller watchdog\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe Robot Controller app will be restarted if it stops responding for more than 10 seconds\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for using the Driver Station app on Android 10+\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIntroduces an automatic TeleOp preselection feature\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFor details and usage guide, please see \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/wiki/Automatically-Loading-a-Driver-Controlled-Op-Mode\"\u003ethis wiki entry\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eShows icon next to OpMode name in the OpMode list dropdown on the Driver Station to indicate the source of the OpMode (i.e. the programming tool used to create it)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes issue where the Driver Station app would exit after displaying the Configuring Wi-Fi Direct screen\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes Blocks and OnBotJava prompts when accessed via the REV Hardware Client\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" is the version for the Ultimate Goal season.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRequires Android Studio 4.0.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAndroid Studio users need to be connected to the Internet the first time they build the app (in order to download needed packages for the build).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eVersion 5.5 was a moderately large off-season, August 2020, drop.  It's worth reviewing those release notes below also.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eVersion 5.5 and greater will not work on older Android 4.x and 5.x phones.  Users must upgrade to an approved Android 6.x device or newer.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe default PIDF values for REV motors have been reverted to the default PID values that were used in the 2018-2019 season\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThis change was made because the 2018-2019 values turned out to work better for many mechanisms\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThis brings the behavior of the REV motors in line with the behavior of all other motors\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf you prefer the 2019-2020 season's behavior for REV motors, here are the PIDF values that were in place, so that you can manually set them in your OpModes:\n\u003cbr\u003e\n\u003cstrong\u003eHD Hex motors (all gearboxes):\u003c/strong\u003e\nVelocity PIDF values: \u003ccode\u003eP = 1.17\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eI = 0.117\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eF = 11.7\u003c/code\u003e\nPosition PIDF values: \u003ccode\u003eP = 5.0\u003c/code\u003e\n\u003cstrong\u003eCore Hex motor:\u003c/strong\u003e\nVelocity PIDF values: \u003ccode\u003eP = 4.96\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eI = 0.496\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003eF = 49.6\u003c/code\u003e\nPosition PIDF values: \u003ccode\u003eP = 5.0\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" interface\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eBy setting the gain of a color sensor, you can adjust for different lighting conditions.\nFor example, if you detect lower color values than expected, you can increase the gain.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe gain value is only applied to the argb() and getNormalizedColors() methods, not to the raw color methods.\nThe getNormalizedColors() method is recommended for ease-of-use and clarity, since argb() has to be converted.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdates SensorColor Java sample to demonstrate gain usage\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMerges SensorREVColorDistance Java sample into SensorColor Java sample, which showcases best practices for all color sensors\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves retrieving values from the REV Color Sensor V3\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdates the normalization calculation of the RGB channels\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves the calculation of the alpha channel (can be used as an overall brightness indicator)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFixes the default sensor resolution, which caused issues with bright environments\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for changing the resolution and measuring rate of the Broadcom sensor chip\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoves IR readings and calculations not meant for the Broadcom sensor chip\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for calling custom Java classes from Blocks OpModes (fixes \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/SkyStone/issues/161\" data-hovercard-type=\"issue\" data-hovercard-url=\"/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/SkyStone/issues/161/hovercard\"\u003eSkyStone issue #161\u003c/a\u003e).\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eClasses must be in the org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode package.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTo have easy access to the opMode, hardwareMap, telemetry, gamepad1, and gamepad2, classes can\nextends org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.BlocksOpModeCompanion.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMethods must be public static and have no more than 21 parameters.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMethods must be annotated with org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.ExportToBlocks.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eParameters declared as OpMode, LinearOpMode, Telemetry, and HardwareMap are supported and the\nargument is provided automatically, regardless of the order of the parameters. On the block,\nthe sockets for those parameters are automatically filled in.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eParameters declared as char or java.lang.Character will accept any block that returns text\nand will only use the first character in the text.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eParameters declared as boolean or java.lang.Boolean will accept any block that returns boolean.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eParameters declared as byte, java.lang.Byte, short, java.lang.Short, int, java.lang.Integer,\nlong, or java.lang.Long,  will accept any block that returns a number and will round that\nvalue to the nearest whole number.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eParameters declared as float, java.lang.Float, double, java.lang.Double will accept any\nblock that returns a number.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds telemetry API method for setting display format\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eClassic\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMonospace\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHTML (certain tags only)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds blocks support for switching cameras.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Blocks support for TensorFlow Object Detection with a custom model.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for uploading a custom TensorFlow Object Detection model in the Manage page, which\nis especially useful for Blocks and OnBotJava users.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eShows new Control Hub blink codes when the Wi-Fi band is switched using the Control Hub's button (only possible on Control Hub OS 1.1.2)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds new warnings which can be disabled in the Advanced RC Settings\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMismatched app versions warning\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUnnecessary 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi usage warning\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eREV Hub is running outdated firmware (older than version 1.8.2)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds support for Sony PS4 gamepad, and reworks how gamepads work on the Driver Station\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoves preference which sets gamepad type based on driver position. Replaced with menu which allows specifying type for gamepads with unknown VID and PID\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAttempts to auto-detect gamepad type based on USB VID and PID\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf gamepad VID and PID is not known, use type specified by user for that VID and PID\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf gamepad VID and PID is not known AND the user has not specified a type for that VID and PID, an educated guess is made about how to map the gamepad\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDriver Station will now attempt to automatically recover from a gamepad disconnecting, and re-assign it to the position it was assigned to when it dropped\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf only one gamepad is assigned and it drops: it can be recovered\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf two gamepads are assigned, and have \u003cstrong\u003edifferent\u003c/strong\u003e VID/PID signatures, and only one drops: it will be recovered\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf two gamepads are assigned, and have \u003cstrong\u003edifferent\u003c/strong\u003e VID/PID signatures, and BOTH drop: both will be recovered\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf two gamepads are assigned, and have \u003cstrong\u003ethe same\u003c/strong\u003e VID/PID signatures, and only one drops: it will be recovered\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eIf two gamepads are assigned, and have \u003cstrong\u003ethe same\u003c/strong\u003e VID/PID signatures, and BOTH drop: \u003cstrong\u003eneither\u003c/strong\u003e will be recovered, because of the ambiguity of the gamepads when they re-appear on the USB bus.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThere is currently one known edge case: if there are \u003cstrong\u003etwo\u003c/strong\u003e gamepads with \u003cstrong\u003ethe same\u003c/strong\u003e VID/PID signature plugged in, \u003cstrong\u003ebut only one is assigned\u003c/strong\u003e, and they BOTH drop, it's a 50-50 chance of which one will be chosen for automatic recovery to the assigned position: it is determined by whichever one is re-enumerated first by the USB bus controller.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds landscape user interface to Driver Station\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew feature: practice timer with audio cues\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew feature (Control Hub only): wireless network connection strength indicator (0-5 bars)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew feature (Control Hub only): tapping on the ping/channel display will switch to an alternate display showing radio RX dBm and link speed (tap again to switch back)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe layout will NOT autorotate. You can switch the layout from the Driver Station's settings menu.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eBreaking changes\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-breaking-changes-6\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Breaking changes\" href=\"#breaking-changes-6\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoves support for Android versions 4.4 through 5.1 (KitKat and Lollipop). 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHandles RS485 address of Control Hub automatically\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe Control Hub is automatically given a reserved address\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eExisting configuration files will continue to work\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAll addresses in the range of 1-10 are still available for Expansion Hubs\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe Control Hub light will now normally be solid green, without blinking to indicate the address\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe Control Hub will not be shown on the Expansion Hub Address Change settings page\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves REV Hub firmware updater\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe user can now choose between all available firmware update files\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eVersion 1.8.2 of the REV Hub firmware is bundled into the Robot Controller app.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eText was added to clarify that Expansion Hubs can only be updated via USB.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFirmware update speed was reduced to improve reliability\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAllows REV Hub firmware to be updated directly from the Manage webpage\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves log viewer on Robot Controller\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHorizontal scrolling support (no longer word wrapped)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eSupports pinch-to-zoom\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUses a monospaced font\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eError messages are highlighted\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew color scheme\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAttempts to force-stop a runaway/stuck OpMode without restarting the entire app\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNot all types of runaway conditions are stoppable, but if the user code attempts to talk to hardware during the runaway, the system should be able to capture it.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMakes various tweaks to the Self Inspect screen\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRenames \"OS version\" entry to \"Android version\"\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRenames \"Wi-Fi Direct Name\" to \"Wi-Fi Name\"\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdds Control Hub OS version, when viewing the report of a Control Hub\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eHides the airplane mode entry, when viewing the report of a Control Hub\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRemoves check for ZTE Speed Channel Changer\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eShows firmware version for \u003cstrong\u003eall\u003c/strong\u003e Expansion and Control Hubs\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eReworks network settings portion of Manage page\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAll network settings are now applied with a single click\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe Wi-Fi Direct channel of phone-based Robot Controllers can now be changed from the Manage page\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eWi-Fi channels are filtered by band (2.4 vs 5 GHz) and whether they overlap with other channels\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eThe current Wi-Fi channel is pre-selected on phone-based Robot Controllers, and Control Hubs running OS 1.1.2 or later.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOn Control Hubs running OS 1.1.2 or later, you can choose to have the system automatically select a channel on the 5 GHz band\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves OnBotJava\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNew light and dark themes replace the old themes (chaos, github, chrome,...)\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ethe new default theme is \u003ccode\u003elight\u003c/code\u003e and will be used when you first update to this version\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eOnBotJava now has a tabbed editor\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRead-only offline mode\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves function of \"exit\" menu item on Robot Controller and Driver Station\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNow guaranteed to be fully stopped and unloaded from memory\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eShows a warning message if a LinearOpMode exists prematurely due to failure to monitor for the start condition\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImproves error message shown when the Driver Station and Robot Controller are incompatible with each other\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDriver Station OpMode Control Panel now disabled while a Restart Robot is in progress\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDisables advanced settings related to Wi-Fi Direct when the Robot Controller is a Control Hub.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTint phone battery icons on Driver Station when low/critical.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUses names \"Control Hub Portal\" and \"Control Hub\" (when appropriate) in new configuration files\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eImprove I2C read performance\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eVery large improvement on Control Hub; up to ~2x faster with small (e.g. 6 byte) reads\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNot as apparent on Expansion Hubs connected to a phone\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate/refresh build infrastructure\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate to 'androidx' support library from 'com.android.support:appcompat', which is end-of-life\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate targetSdkVersion and compileSdkVersion to 28\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eUpdate Android Studio's Android plugin to latest\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFix reported build timestamp in 'About' screen\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eAdd sample illustrating manual webcam use: ConceptWebcam\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eBug
