<p dir="auto">This repository contains the public FTC SDK for the INTO THE DEEP (2024-2025) competition season.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Welcome!</h2><a id="user-content-welcome" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Welcome!" href="#welcome"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">This GitHub repository contains the source code that is used to build an Android app to control a <em>FIRST</em> Tech Challenge competition robot.  To use this SDK, download/clone the entire project to your local computer.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Requirements</h2><a id="user-content-requirements" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Requirements" href="#requirements"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">To use this Android Studio project, you will need Android Studio 2021.2 (codename Chipmunk) or later.</p>
<p dir="auto">To program your robot in Blocks or OnBot Java, you do not need Android Studio.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Getting Started</h2><a id="user-content-getting-started" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Getting Started" href="#getting-started"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">If you are new to robotics or new to the <em>FIRST</em> Tech Challenge, then you should consider reviewing the <a href="https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/programming_resources/blocks/Blocks-Tutorial.html" rel="nofollow">FTC Blocks Tutorial</a> to get familiar with how to use the control system:</p>
<p dir="auto"><a href="https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/programming_resources/blocks/Blocks-Tutorial.html" rel="nofollow">FTC Blocks Online Tutorial</a></p>
<p dir="auto">Even if you are an advanced Java programmer, it is helpful to start with the <a href="https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/programming_resources/blocks/Blocks-Tutorial.html" rel="nofollow">FTC Blocks tutorial</a>, and then migrate to the <a href="https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/programming_resources/onbot_java/OnBot-Java-Tutorial.html" rel="nofollow">OnBot Java Tool</a> or to <a href="https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/programming_resources/android_studio_java/Android-Studio-Tutorial.html" rel="nofollow">Android Studio</a> afterwards.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Downloading the Project</h2><a id="user-content-downloading-the-project" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Downloading the Project" href="#downloading-the-project"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">If you are an Android Studio programmer, there are several ways to download this repo.  Note that if you use the Blocks or OnBot Java Tool to program your robot, then you do not need to download this repository.</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>If you are a git user, you can clone the most current version of the repository:</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto">git clone <a href="https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController.git">https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController.git</a></p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>
<p dir="auto">Or, if you prefer, you can use the "Download Zip" button available through the main repository page.  Downloading the project as a .ZIP file will keep the size of the download manageable.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="auto">You can also download the project folder (as a .zip or .tar.gz archive file) from the Downloads subsection of the <a href="https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/releases">Releases</a> page for this repository.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p dir="auto">The Releases page also contains prebuilt APKs.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto">Once you have downloaded and uncompressed (if needed) your folder, you can use Android Studio to import the folder  ("Import project (Eclipse ADT, Gradle, etc.)").</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Getting Help</h2><a id="user-content-getting-help" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Getting Help" href="#getting-help"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">User Documentation and Tutorials</h3><a id="user-content-user-documentation-and-tutorials" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: User Documentation and Tutorials" href="#user-documentation-and-tutorials"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto"><em>FIRST</em> maintains online documentation with information and tutorials on how to use the <em>FIRST</em> Tech Challenge software and robot control system.  You can access this documentation using the following link:</p>
<p dir="auto"><a href="https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/index.html" rel="nofollow">FIRST Tech Challenge Documentation</a></p>
<p dir="auto">Note that the online documentation is an "evergreen" document that is constantly being updated and edited.  It contains the most current information about the <em>FIRST</em> Tech Challenge software and control system.</p>

<p dir="auto">For technical questions regarding the Control System or the FTC SDK, please visit the FIRST Tech Challenge Community site:</p>
<p dir="auto"><a href="https://ftc-community.firstinspires.org/" rel="nofollow">FIRST Tech Challenge Community</a></p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Sample OpModes</h3><a id="user-content-sample-opmodes" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Sample OpModes" href="#sample-opmodes"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">This project contains a large selection of Sample OpModes (robot code examples) which can be cut and pasted into your /teamcode folder to be used as-is, or modified to suit your team's needs.</p>
<p dir="auto">Samples Folder:  <a href="/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/blob/master/FtcRobotController/src/main/java/org/firstinspires/ftc/robotcontroller/external/samples">/FtcRobotController/src/main/java/org/firstinspires/ftc/robotcontroller/external/samples</a></p>
<p dir="auto">The readme.md file located in the <a href="/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/blob/master/TeamCode/src/main/java/org/firstinspires/ftc/teamcode">/TeamCode/src/main/java/org/firstinspires/ftc/teamcode</a> folder contains an explanation of the sample naming convention, and instructions on how to copy them to your own project space.</p>

<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Breaking Changes</h3><a id="user-content-breaking-changes" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Breaking Changes" href="#breaking-changes"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Java classes and Blocks for TensorFlow Object Detection have been removed.</li>
<li><code>AngularVelocity.unit</code> which was of type <code>AngleUnit</code> has been renamed <code>AngularVelocity.angleUnit</code> of type <code>UnnormalizedAngleUnit</code></li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Enhancements</h3><a id="user-content-enhancements" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Enhancements" href="#enhancements"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Sample for REV Digital Indicator has been added - ConceptRevLED</li>
<li>Adds support for the <a href="https://www.sparkfun.com/products/18354" rel="nofollow">Sparkfun QWIIC LED Stick</a>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>To connect it directly, you need this <a href="https://www.sparkfun.com/products/25596" rel="nofollow">cable</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds ConceptLEDStick OpMode</li>
<li>Adds Blocks for colors black, blue, cyan, dkgray, gray, green, ltgray, magenta, red, white, and yellow.</li>
<li>Adds an "evaluate but ignore result" Block that executes the connected block and ignores the result. Allows you to call a function and ignore the return value.</li>
<li>Adds I2C driver for Maxbotix Maxsonar I2CXL sonar rangefinder</li>
<li>Adds Blocks for setPwmEnable, setPwmDisable, and isPwmEnabled for servos and CR servos.</li>
<li>In the Blocks editor: a \n in the ExportToBlocks annotation's comment field is displayed as a line break.</li>
<li>Telemetry has new method setNumDecimalPlaces</li>
<li>Telemetry now formats doubles and floats (not inside objects, just by themselves)</li>
<li>Adds support for the Limelight 3A.</li>
<li>Adds initial support for the REV Servo Hub
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Both the Robot Controller and Driver Station need to be updated to version 10.0 in order for Servo Hubs to be
configurable as Servo Hubs. If the app on either device is outdated, the Servo Hub will show up as an Expansion Hub,
and some functionality will not work as expected. You should wait to create a configuration that includes a Servo Hub
until both the Driver Station and Robot Controller apps have been updated to version 10.0.</li>
<li>Updating the Servo Hub's firmware and changing its address can only be done using the REV Hardware Client at this time</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds support for the REV 9-Axis IMU (REV-31-3332)
<ul dir="auto">
<li>The REV 9-Axis IMU is only supported by the <a href="https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/en/latest/programming_resources/imu/imu.html" rel="nofollow">Universal IMU interface</a></li>
<li>Adds <code>Rev9AxisImuOrientationOnRobot</code> Java class.</li>
<li>If you mentally substitute this IMU's I2C port for the Control Hub's USB ports, <code>RevHubOrientationOnRobot</code> is also compatible with this sensor</li>
<li>Adds Blocks for Rev9AxisImuOrientationOnRobot, including RevHubImuOrientationOnRobot.xyzOrientation and  RevHubImuOrientationOnRobot.zyxOrientation.</li>
<li>Adds Blocks samples SensorRev9AxisIMUOrthogonal and SensorRev9AxisIMUNonOrthogonal.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Improves Blocks support for RevHubImuOrientationOnRobot.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Adds Blocks for RevHubImuOrientationOnRobot.xyzOrientation and  RevHubImuOrientationOnRobot.zyxOrientation.</li>
<li>Adds Blocks samples SensorHubIMUOrthogonal (replaces SensorIMU) and SensorHubIMUNonOrthogonal.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Updates EasyOpenCV, AprilTag, OpenCV, and <code>libjpeg-turbo</code> versions</li>
<li>Adds Blocks for max and min that take two numbers.</li>
<li>Adds Blocks OpModes ConceptRevSPARKMini, RobotAutoDriveByEncoder, RobotAutoDriveByGyro, RobotAutoDriveByTime, RobotAutoDriveToAprilTagOmni, and RobotAutoDriveToAprilTagTank.</li>
<li>Two OpModes with the same name now automatically get renamed with the name followed by a "-" and the class name allowing them to both be on the device.</li>
<li>Shows the name of the active configuration on the Manage page of the Robot Controller Console</li>
<li>Updated AprilTag Library for INTO THE DEEP. Notably, <code>getCurrentGameTagLibrary()</code> now returns INTO THE DEEP tags.</li>
<li>Adds Blocks for Telemetry.setMsTransmissionInterval and Telemetry.getMsTransmissionInterval.</li>
<li>Adds Blocks sample SensorOctoQuad.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Bug Fixes</h3><a id="user-content-bug-fixes" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Bug Fixes" href="#bug-fixes"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Fixes a bug where the RevBlinkinLedDriver Blocks were under Actuators in the Blocks editor toolbox. They are now Other Devices.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where <code>Exception</code>s thrown in user code after a stop was requested by the Driver Station would be silently eaten</li>
<li>Fixed a bug where if you asked for <code>AngularVelocity</code> in a unit different than the device reported it in, it would normalize it between -PI and PI for radians, and -180 and 180 for degrees.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Version 9.2 (20240701-085519)</h2><a id="user-content-version-92-20240701-085519" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Version 9.2 (20240701-085519)" href="#version-92-20240701-085519"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Important Notes</h3><a id="user-content-important-notes" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Important Notes" href="#important-notes"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Java classes and Blocks for TensorFlow Object Detection have been deprecated and will be removed in Version 10.0.</li>
<li>The samples that use TensorFlow Object Detection have been removed.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Enhancements</h3><a id="user-content-enhancements-1" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Enhancements" href="#enhancements-1"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Adds explanatory text to failed items on the inspection activities.  To view the explanatory text tap the red warning icon for a failed item.</li>
<li>In the Blocks editor: added a new kind of variable set block that sets the variable and also returns the new value.</li>
<li>Changes the way that camera controls behave for a SwitchableCamera. Now, each method (such as getExposure, getMinExposure, getMaxExposure, setExposure for ExposureControl) acts on the currently active camera.</li>
<li>Adds support for the REV USB PS4 Compatible Gamepad (REV-31-2983)</li>
<li>Adds ConceptAprilTagMultiPortal OpMode</li>
<li>Adds support for OctoQuad Quadrature Encoder & Pulse Width Interface Module</li>
<li>Adds the ExportAprilTagLibraryToBlocks annotation that indicates that a static method that returns an AprilTagLibrary is exported to the Blocks programming environment. The corresponding block will appear in the Blocks toolbox along with the built-in tag libraries.</li>
<li>Adds Blocks OpMode ConceptAprilTagOptimizeExposure.</li>
<li>Adds support for the SparkFun Optical Tracking Odometry sensor.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Bug Fixes</h3><a id="user-content-bug-fixes-1" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Bug Fixes" href="#bug-fixes-1"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Fixes <a class="issue-link js-issue-link" data-error-text="Failed to load title" data-id="2140493347" data-permission-text="Title is private" data-url="https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/942" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/942/hovercard" href="https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/942">#942</a> where visionPortal.close() can cause an IndexOutOfBoundsError.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug in the blocks editor where collapsed function blocks show a warning "Collapsed blocks contain warnings." when the Blocks OpMode is reopened.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the blocks editor wouldn't warn you that you have unsaved changes when you try to leave. This bug was introduced due to a behavior change in Chrome 119.</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/764" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/764/hovercard">Issue #764</a> - Get gain control returns a null pointer for a switchable camera</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the correct deadzone for certain gamepads was not applied when Advanced Gamepad Features was enabled</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Version 9.1 (20240215-115542)</h2><a id="user-content-version-91-20240215-115542" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Version 9.1 (20240215-115542)" href="#version-91-20240215-115542"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Enhancements</h3><a id="user-content-enhancements-2" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Enhancements" href="#enhancements-2"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Fixes a problem with Blocks: if the user closes a Block's warning balloon, it will still be closed next time the project is opened in the Blocks editor.</li>
<li>In the Blocks editor, an alert concerning missing hardware devices is not shown if all the Blocks that use the missing hardware devices are disabled.</li>
<li>Adds Blocks to support comparing property values CRServo.Direction, DCMotor.Direction, DCMotor.Mode, DCMotor.ZeroPowerBehavior, DigitalChannel.Mode, GyroSensor.HeadingMode, IrSeekerSensor.Mode, and Servo.Direction, to the corresponding enum Block.</li>
<li>Improves OnBotJava auto-import to correctly import classes when used in certain situations.</li>
<li>Improves OnBotJava autocomplete to provide better completion options in most cases.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>This fixes an issue where autocomplete would fail if a method with two or more formal parameters was defined.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>In OnBotJava, code folding support was added to expand and collapse code sections</li>
<li>In OnBotJava, the copyright header is now automatically collapsed loading new files</li>
<li>For all Blocks OpMode samples, intro comments have been moved to the RunOpMode comment balloon.</li>
<li>The Clean up Blocks command in the Blocks editor now positions function Blocks so their comment balloons don't overlap other function Blocks.</li>
<li>Added Blocks OpMode sample SensorTouch.</li>
<li>Added Java OpMode sample SensorDigitalTouch.</li>
<li>Several improvements to VisionPortal
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Adds option to control whether the stream is automatically started following a <code>.build()</code> call on a VisionPortal Builder</li>
<li>Adds option to control whether the vision processing statistics overlay is rendered or not</li>
<li>VisionPortals now implement the <code>CameraStreamSource</code> interface, allowing multiportal users to select which portal is routed to the DS in INIT by calling CameraStreamServer.getInstance().setSource(visionPortal). Can be selected via gamepad, between Camera Stream sessions.</li>
<li>Add option to <code>AprilTagProcessor</code> to suppress calibration warnings</li>
<li>Improves camera calibration warnings
<ul dir="auto">
<li>If a calibration is scaled, the resolution it was scaled from will be listed</li>
<li>If calibrations exist with the wrong aspect ratio, the calibrated resolutions will be listed</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Fixes race condition which caused app crash when calling <code>stopStreaming()</code> immediately followed by <code>close()</code> on a VisionPortal</li>
<li>Fixes IllegalStateException when calling <code>stopStreaming()</code> immediately after building a VisionPortal</li>
<li>Added FTC Blocks counterparts to new Java methods:
<ul dir="auto">
<li>VisionPortal.Builder.setAutoStartStreamOnBuild</li>
<li>VisionPortal.Builder.setShowStatsOverlay</li>
<li>AprilTagProcessor.Builder.setSuppressCalibrationWarnings</li>
<li>CameraStreamServer.setSource</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Bug Fixes</h3><a id="user-content-bug-fixes-2" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Bug Fixes" href="#bug-fixes-2"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Fixes a problem where OnBotJava does not apply font size settings to the editor.</li>
<li>Updates EasyOpenCV dependency to v1.7.1
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Fixes inability to use EasyOpenCV CameraFactory in OnBotJava</li>
<li>Fixes entire RC app crash when user pipeline throws an exception</li>
<li>Fixes entire RC app crash when user user canvas annotator throws an exception</li>
<li>Use the modern stacktrace display when handling user exceptions instead of the legacy ESTOP telemetry message</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Version 9.0.1 (20230929-083754)</h2><a id="user-content-version-901-20230929-083754" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Version 9.0.1 (20230929-083754)" href="#version-901-20230929-083754"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Enhancements</h3><a id="user-content-enhancements-3" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Enhancements" href="#enhancements-3"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Updates AprilTag samples to include Decimation and additional Comments.  Also corrects misleading tag ID warnings</li>
<li>Increases maximum size of Blocks inline comments to 140 characters</li>
<li>Adds Blocks sample BasicOmniOpMode.</li>
<li>Updated CENTERSTAGE library AprilTag orientation quaternions
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Thanks <a href="https://github.com/FromenActual">@FromenActual</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Updated Java Sample ConceptTensorFlowObjectDetection.java to include missing elements needed for custom model support.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Bug Fixes</h3><a id="user-content-bug-fixes-3" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Bug Fixes" href="#bug-fixes-3"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Fixes a problem where after October 1 the Driver Station will report as obsolete on v9.0 and prompt the user to update.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Version 9.0 (20230830-154348)</h2><a id="user-content-version-90-20230830-154348" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Version 9.0 (20230830-154348)" href="#version-90-20230830-154348"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Breaking Changes</h3><a id="user-content-breaking-changes-1" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Breaking Changes" href="#breaking-changes-1"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Removes Vuforia</li>
<li>Fields in <code>AprilTagDetection</code> and <code>AprilTagPose(ftc/raw)</code> objects are now <code>final</code></li>
<li>VisionPortal builder method <code>setCameraMonitorViewId()</code> has been renamed to <code>setLiveViewContainerId()</code> and <code>enableCameraMonitoring()</code> has been renamed to <code>enableLiveView()</code></li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Enhancements</h3><a id="user-content-enhancements-4" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Enhancements" href="#enhancements-4"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Adds support for the DFRobot HuskyLens Vision Sensor.</li>
<li>Blocks teams can now perform webcam calibration.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Added a Block for System.currentTimeMillis (under Utilities/Time)</li>
<li>Added a Block for VisionPortal.saveNextFrameRaw (under Vision/VisionPortal)</li>
<li>Added a new sample Blocks OpMode called UtilityCameraFrameCapture.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>The RobotDriveByGyro sample has been updated to use the new universal IMU interface.  It now supports both IMU types.</li>
<li>Removed some error-prone ElapsedTime Blocks from the Blocks editor's toolbox. This is not a
breaking change: old Blocks OpModes that use these Blocks will still function, both in the
Blocks editor and at runtime.</li>
<li>Standardizes on the form "OpMode" for the term OpMode.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>The preferred way to refer to OpModes that specifically extend <code>LinearOpMode</code> (including Blocks OpModes) is "linear OpMode".</li>
<li>The preferred way to refer to OpModes that specifically extend <code>OpMode</code> directly is "iterative OpMode".</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Overhauls <code>OpMode</code> and <code>LinearOpMode</code> Javadoc comments to be easier to read and include more detail.</li>
<li>Makes minor enhancements to Java samples
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Javadoc comments in samples that could be rendered badly in Android Studio have been converted to standard multi-line comments</li>
<li>Consistency between samples has been improved</li>
<li>The SensorDigitalTouch sample has been replaced with a new SensorTouch sample that uses the <code>TouchSensor</code> interface instead of <code>DigitalChannel</code>.</li>
<li>The ConceptCompassCalibration, SensorMRCompass, and SensorMRIRSeeker samples have been deleted, as they are not useful for modern FTC competitions.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Bug Fixes</h3><a id="user-content-bug-fixes-4" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Bug Fixes" href="#bug-fixes-4"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Fixes a bug which prevented PlayStation gamepads from being used in bluetooth mode. Bluetooth is NOT legal for competition but may be useful to allow a DS device to be used while charging, or at an outreach event.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where a Blocks OpMode's Date Modified value can change to December 31, 1969, if the Control Hub is rebooted while the Blocks OpMode is being edited.</li>
<li>Fixes the automatic TeleOp preselection feature (was broken in 8.2)</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where passing an integer number such as 123 to the Telemetry.addData block that takes a number shows up as 123.0 in the telemetry.</li>
<li>Fixes OnBotJava autocomplete issues:
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Autocomplete would incorrectly provide values for the current class when autocompleting a local variable</li>
<li><code>hardwareMap</code> autocomplete would incorrectly include lambda class entries</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Fixes OnBotJava not automatically importing classes.</li>
<li>Fixes OnBotJava tabs failing to close when their file is deleted.</li>
<li>Fixes a project view refresh not happening when a file is renamed in OnBotJava.</li>
<li>Fixes the "Download" context menu item for external libraries in the OnBotJava interface.</li>
<li>Fixes issue where Driver Station telemetry would intermittently freeze when set to Monospace mode.</li>
<li>Fixes performance regression for certain REV Hub operations that was introduced in version 8.2.</li>
<li>Fixes TagID comparison logic in DriveToTag samples.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Version 8.2 (20230707-131020)</h2><a id="user-content-version-82-20230707-131020" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Version 8.2 (20230707-131020)" href="#version-82-20230707-131020"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Breaking Changes</h3><a id="user-content-breaking-changes-2" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Breaking Changes" href="#breaking-changes-2"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Non-linear (iterative) OpModes are no longer allowed to manipulate actuators in their <code>stop()</code> method. Attempts to do so will be ignored and logged.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>When an OpMode attempts to illegally manipulate an actuator, the Robot Controller will print a log message
including the text <code>CANCELLED_FOR_SAFETY</code>.</li>
<li>Additionally, LinearOpModes are no longer able to regain the ability to manipulate actuators by removing their
thread's interrupt or using another thread.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Removes support for Android version 6.0 (Marshmallow). The minSdkVersion is now 24.</li>
<li>Increases the Robocol version.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>This means an 8.2 or later Robot Controller or Driver Station will not be able to communicate with an 8.1 or earlier Driver Station or Robot Controller.</li>
<li>If you forget to update both apps at the same time, an error message will be shown explaining which app is older and should be updated.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>FTC_FieldCoordinateSystemDefinition.pdf has been moved.  It is still in the git history, but has been removed from the git snapshot corresponding with the 8.2 tag.  The official version now lives at <a href="https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/field-coordinate-system" rel="nofollow">Field Coordinate System</a>.</li>
<li><code>LynxUsbDevice.addConfiguredModule()</code> and <code>LynxUsbDevice.getConfiguredModule()</code> have been replaced with <code>LynxUsbDevice.getOrAddModule()</code>.</li>
<li>Old Blocks for Vuforia and TensorFlow Object Detection are obsolete and have been removed from the
Blocks editor's toolbox. Existing Blocks OpModes that contain the old Blocks for Vuforia or
TensorFlow Object Detection can be opened in the Blocks editor, but running them will not work.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">New features</h3><a id="user-content-new-features" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: New features" href="#new-features"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Adds new <code>VisionPortal</code> API for computer vision
<ul dir="auto">
<li><strong>This API may be subject to change for final kickoff release!</strong></li>
<li>Several new samples added.</li>
<li>Adds support for detecting AprilTags.</li>
<li><code>VisionPortal</code> is the new entry point for both AprilTag and TFOD processing.</li>
<li>Vuforia will be removed in a future release.</li>
<li>Updated TensorFlow dependencies.</li>
<li>Added support for webcam camera controls to blocks.</li>
<li>The Blocks editor's toolbox now has a Vision category, directly above the Utilities category.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Related documentation for associated technologies can be found at
<ul dir="auto">
<li><a href="https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/apriltag-intro" rel="nofollow">AprilTag Introduction</a></li>
<li><a href="https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/apriltag-sdk" rel="nofollow">AprilTag SDK Guide</a></li>
<li><a href="https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/apriltag-detection-values" rel="nofollow">AprilTag Detection Values</a></li>
<li><a href="https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/apriltag-test-images" rel="nofollow">AprilTag Test Images</a></li>
<li><a href="https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/camera-calibration" rel="nofollow">Camera Calibration</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds Driver Station support for Logitech Dual Action and Sony PS5 DualSense gamepads.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>This <strong>does not</strong> include support for the Sony PS5 DualSense Edge gamepad.</li>
<li>Always refer to Game Manual 1 to determine gamepad legality in competition.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds support for MJPEG payload streaming to UVC driver (external JPEG decompression routine required for use).</li>
<li>Shows a hint on the Driver Station UI about how to bind a gamepad when buttons are pressed or the sticks are moved on an unbound gamepad.</li>
<li>Adds option for fullscreening "Camera Stream" on Driver Station.</li>
<li>OnBotJava source code is automatically saved as a ZIP file on every build with a rolling window of the last 30 builds kept; allows recovering source code from previous builds if code is accidentally deleted or corrupted.</li>
<li>Adds support for changing the addresses of Expansion Hubs that are not connected directly via USB.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>The Expansion Hub Address Change screen now has an Apply button that changes the addresses without leaving the screen.</li>
<li>Addresses that are assigned to other hubs connected to the same USB connection or Control Hub are no longer able to be selected.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Increases maximum size of Blocks inline comments to 100 characters</li>
<li>Saves position of open Blocks comment balloons</li>
<li>Adds new AprilTag Driving samples:  RobotDriveToAprilTagTank & RobotDriveToAprilTagOmni</li>
<li>Adds Sample to illustrate optimizing camera exposure for AprilTags: ConceptAprilTagOptimizeExposure</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Bug Fixes</h3><a id="user-content-bug-fixes-5" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Bug Fixes" href="#bug-fixes-5"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Corrects inspection screen to report app version using the SDK version defined in the libraries instead of the version specified in <code>AndroidManifest.xml</code>. This corrects the case where the app could show matching versions numbers to the user but still state that the versions did not match.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>If the version specified in <code>AndroidManifest.xml</code> does not match the SDK version, an SDK version entry will be displayed on the Manage webpage.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Fixes no error being displayed when saving a configuration file with duplicate names from the Driver Station.</li>
<li>Fixes a deadlock in the UVC driver which manifested in <a class="issue-link js-issue-link" data-error-text="Failed to load title" data-id="1460450912" data-permission-text="Title is private" data-url="https://github.com/OpenFTC/EasyOpenCV/issues/57" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/OpenFTC/EasyOpenCV/issues/57/hovercard" href="https://github.com/OpenFTC/EasyOpenCV/issues/57">OpenFTC/EasyOpenCV#57</a>.</li>
<li>Fixes a deadlock in the UVC driver that could occur when hot-plugging cameras.</li>
<li>Fixes UVC driver compatibility with Arducam OV9281 global shutter camera.</li>
<li>Fixes Emergency Stop condition when an OnBotJava build with duplicate OpMode names occurs.</li>
<li>Fixes known causes of "Attempted use of a closed LynxModule instance" logspam.</li>
<li>Fixes the visual identification LED pattern when configuring Expansion Hubs connected via RS-485.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Version 8.1.1 (20221201-150726)</h2><a id="user-content-version-811-20221201-150726" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Version 8.1.1 (20221201-150726)" href="#version-811-20221201-150726"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">This is a bug fix only release to address the following four issues.</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li><a href="https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/492" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/492/hovercard">Issue #492</a> - Can't create new blocks opmodes.</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/495" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/495/hovercard">Issue #495</a> - Remove the final modifier from the OpMode's Telemetry object.</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/500" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/500/hovercard">Issue #500</a> - Some devices cannot be configured when the Driver Station app has been updated to 8.1
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Updating either the Robot Controller app or the Driver Station app to 8.1.1 or later will fix this issue.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>The Modern Robotics touch sensor was configurable as a  Digital Device. It can only be used as an Analog Device.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Version 8.1 (20221121-115119)</h2><a id="user-content-version-81-20221121-115119" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Version 8.1 (20221121-115119)" href="#version-81-20221121-115119"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Breaking Changes</h3><a id="user-content-breaking-changes-3" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Breaking Changes" href="#breaking-changes-3"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Deprecates the <code>OpMode</code> fields <code>msStuckDetectInit</code>, <code>msStuckDetectInitLoop</code>, <code>msStuckDetectStart</code>, <code>msStuckDetectLoop</code>, and <code>msStuckDetectStop</code>.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>OpModes no longer have a time limit for <code>init()</code>, <code>init_loop()</code>, <code>start()</code> or <code>loop()</code>, so the fields corresponding to those methods are no longer used.</li>
<li><code>stop()</code> still has a time limit, but it is now hardcoded to be 1 second, and cannot be changed using <code>msStuckDetectStop</code>.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Deprecates the <code>OpMode</code> methods <code>internalPreInit()</code>, <code>internalPostInitLoop()</code>, and <code>internalPostLoop()</code>.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Iterative <code>OpMode</code>s will continue to call these methods in case they were overridden.</li>
<li>These methods will not be called at all for <code>LinearOpMode</code>s.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Deprecates (and stops respecting) <code>DeviceProperties.xmlTagAliases</code>.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Enhancements</h3><a id="user-content-enhancements-5" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Enhancements" href="#enhancements-5"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Adds a new <code>IMU</code> interface to Blocks and Java that can be used with both the original BNO055 IMU
included in all older Control Hubs and Expansion Hubs, and the new alternative BHI260AP IMU.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>You can determine which type of IMU is in your Control Hub by navigating to the Manage page of the web interface.</li>
<li>To learn how to use the new <code>IMU</code> interface, see <a href="https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/programming_resources/imu/imu.html" rel="nofollow">https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/programming_resources/imu/imu.html</a>. The <code>SensorIMU</code> Blocks sample was also updated to use the new <code>IMU</code> interface, and the following Java samples were added:
<ul dir="auto">
<li><code>SensorIMUOrthogonal</code>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Use this sample if your REV Hub is mounted so that it is parallel or perpendicular to the
bottom of your robot.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><code>SensorIMUNonOrthogonal</code>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Use this sample if your REV Hub is mounted to your robot in any other orientation</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><code>ConceptExploringIMUOrientations</code>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>This OpMode is a tool to help you understand how the orthogonal orientations work, and
which one applies to your robot.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>The BHI260AP IMU can only be accessed via the new <code>IMU</code> interface. The BNO055 IMU can be
programmed using the new <code>IMU</code> interface, or you can continue to program it using the old <code>BNO055IMU</code>
interface. If you want to be able to quickly switch to a new Control Hub that may contain the
BHI260AP IMU, you should migrate your code to use the new <code>IMU</code> interface.</li>
<li>Unlike the old <code>BNO055IMU</code> interface, which only worked correctly when the REV Hub was mounted flat
on your robot, the <code>IMU</code> interface allows you to specify the orientation of the REV Hub on your
robot. It will account for this, and give you your orientation in a Robot Coordinate System,
instead of a special coordinate system for the REV Hub. As a result, your pitch and yaw will be
0 when your <em>robot</em> is level, instead of when the REV Hub is level, which will result in much
more reliable orientation angle values for most mounting orientations.</li>
<li>Because of the new robot-centric coordinate system, the pitch and roll angles returned by the
<code>IMU</code> interface will be different from the ones returned by the <code>BNO055IMU</code> interface. When you are
migrating your code, pay careful attention to the documentation.</li>
<li>If you have calibrated your BNO055, you can provide that calibration data to the new <code>IMU</code>
interface by passing a <code>BNO055IMUNew.Parameters</code> instance to <code>IMU.initialize()</code>.</li>
<li>The <code>IMU</code> interface is also suitable for implementation by third-party vendors for IMUs that
support providing the orientation in the form of a quaternion.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Iterative <code>OpMode</code>s (as opposed to <code>LinearOpMode</code>s) now run on a dedicated thread.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Cycle times should not be as impacted by everything else going on in the system.</li>
<li>Slow <code>OpMode</code>s can no longer increase the amount of time it takes to process network commands, and vice versa.</li>
<li>The <code>init()</code>, <code>init_loop()</code>, <code>start()</code> and <code>loop()</code> methods no longer need to return within a certain time frame.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>BNO055 IMU legacy driver: restores the ability to initialize in one OpMode, and then have another OpMode re-use that
initialization. This allows you to maintain the 0-yaw position between OpModes, if desired.</li>
<li>Allows customized versions of device drivers in the FTC SDK to use the same XML tag.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Before, if you wanted to customize a device driver, you had to copy it to a new class <em>and</em> give
it a new XML tag. Giving it a new XML tag meant that to switch which driver was being used, you
had to modify your configuration file.</li>
<li>Now, to use your custom driver, all you have to do is specify your custom driver's class when
calling <code>hardwareMap.get()</code>. To go back to the original driver, specify the original driver
class. If you specify an interface that is implemented by both the original driver and the
custom driver, there is no guarantee about which implementation will be returned.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Bug Fixes</h3><a id="user-content-bug-fixes-6" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Bug Fixes" href="#bug-fixes-6"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Fixes accessing the "Manage TensorFlow Lite Models" and "Manage Sounds" links and performing
Blocks and OnBotJava OpMode downloads from the REV Hardware Client.</li>
<li>Fixes issue where an I2C device driver would be auto-initialized using the parameters assigned in
a previous OpMode run.</li>
<li>Improves Driver Station popup menu placement in the landscape layout.</li>
<li>Fixes NullPointerException when attempting to get a non-configured BNO055 IMU in a Blocks OpMode on an RC phone.</li>
<li>Fixes problem with Blocks if a variable is named <code>orientation</code>.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Version 8.0 (20220907-131644)</h2><a id="user-content-version-80-20220907-131644" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Version 8.0 (20220907-131644)" href="#version-80-20220907-131644"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Breaking Changes</h3><a id="user-content-breaking-changes-4" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Breaking Changes" href="#breaking-changes-4"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Increases the Robocol version.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>This means an 8.0 or later Robot Controller or Driver Station will not be able to communicate with a 7.2 or earlier Driver Station or Robot Controller.</li>
<li>If you forget to update both apps at the same time, an error message will be shown explaining which app is older and should be updated.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Initializing I2C devices now happens when you retrieve them from the <code>HardwareMap</code> for the first time.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Previously, all I2C devices would be initialized before the OpMode even began executing,
whether you were actually going to use them or not. This could result in reduced performance and
unnecessary warnings.</li>
<li>With this change, it is very important for Java users to retrieve all needed devices from the
<code>HardwareMap</code> <strong>during the Init phase of the OpMode</strong>. Namely, declare a variable for each hardware
device the OpMode will use, and assign a value to each. Do not do this during the Run phase, or your
OpMode may briefly hang while the devices you are retrieving get initialized.</li>
<li>OpModes that do not use all of the I2C devices specified in the configuration file should take
less time to initialize. OpModes that do use all of the specified I2C devices should take the
same amount of time as previously.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Fixes <a href="https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/251" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/251/hovercard">issue #251</a> by changing the order in which axis rotation rates are read from the angular velocity vector in the BNO055 IMU driver.</li>
<li>Deprecates <code>pitchMode</code> in <code>BNO055IMU.Parameters</code>.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Setting <code>pitchMode</code> to <code>PitchMode.WINDOWS</code> would break the coordinate conventions used by the driver.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Moves <code>OpModeManagerImpl</code> to the <code>com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode</code> package.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>This breaks third party libraries EasyOpenCV (version 1.5.1 and earlier) and FTC Dashboard (version 0.4.4 and earlier).</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Deletes the deprecated <code>OpMode</code> method <code>resetStartTime()</code> (use <code>resetRuntime()</code> instead).</li>
<li>Deletes the protected <code>LinearOpMode.LinearOpModeHelper</code> class (which was not meant for use by OpModes).</li>
<li>Removes I2C Device (Synchronous) config type (deprecated since 2018)</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Enhancements</h3><a id="user-content-enhancements-6" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Enhancements" href="#enhancements-6"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Uncaught exceptions in OpModes no longer require a Restart Robot
<ul dir="auto">
<li>A blue screen popping up with a stacktrace is not an SDK error; this replaces the red text in the telemetry area.</li>
<li>Since the very first SDK release, OpMode crashes have put the robot into "EMERGENCY STOP" state, only showing the first line of the exception, and requiring the user to press "Restart Robot" to continue</li>
<li>Exceptions during an OpMode now open a popup window with the same color scheme as the log viewer, containing 15 lines of the exception stacktrace to allow easily tracing down the offending line without needing to connect to view logs over ADB or scroll through large amounts of logs in the log viewer.</li>
<li>The exception text in the popup window is both zoomable and scrollable just like a webpage.</li>
<li>Pressing the "OK" button in the popup window will return to the main screen of the Driver Station and allow an OpMode to be run again immediately, without the need to perform a "Restart Robot"</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds new Java sample to demonstrate using a hardware class to abstract robot actuators, and share them across multiple OpModes.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Sample OpMode is <a href="/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/blob/master/FtcRobotController/src/main/java/org/firstinspires/ftc/robotcontroller/external/samples/ConceptExternalHardwareClass.java">ConceptExternalHardwareClass.java</a></li>
<li>Abstracted hardware class is <a href="/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/blob/master/FtcRobotController/src/main/java/org/firstinspires/ftc/robotcontroller/external/samples/RobotHardware.java">RobotHardware.java</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Updates RobotAutoDriveByGyro_Linear Java sample to use REV Control/Expansion hub IMU.</li>
<li>Updates Vuforia samples to reference PowerPlay assets and have correct names and field locations of image targets.</li>
<li>Updates TensorFlow samples to reference PowerPlay assets.</li>
<li>Adds opt-in support for Java 8 language features to the OnBotJava editor.
<ul dir="auto">
<li>To opt in, open the OnBotJava Settings, and check <code>Enable beta Java 8 support</code>.</li>
<li>Note that Java 8 code will only compile when the Robot Controller runs Android 7.0 Nougat or later.</li>
<li>Please report issues <a href="https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues">here</a>.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>In OnBotJava, clicking on build errors now correctly jumps to the correct location.</li>
<li>Improves OnBotJava autocomplete behavior, to provide better completion options in most cases.</li>
<li>Adds a QR code to the Robot Controller Inspection Report when viewed from the Driver Station for scanning by inspectors at competition.</li>
<li>Improves I2C performance and reliability in some scenarios.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Version 7.2 (20220723-130006)</h2><a id="user-content-version-72-20220723-130006" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Version 7.2 (20220723-130006)" href="#version-72-20220723-130006"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Breaking Changes</h3><a id="user-content-breaking-changes-5" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Breaking Changes" href="#breaking-changes-5"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Updates the build tooling.  For Android Studio users, this change requires Android Studio Chipmunk 2021.2.1.</li>
<li>Removes support for devices that are not competition legal, including Modern Robotics Core Control Modules, the Matrix Controller, and HiTechnic/NXT controllers and sensors.  Support remains for Modern Robotics I2C sensors.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Enhancements</h3><a id="user-content-enhancements-7" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Enhancements" href="#enhancements-7"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Increases the height of the 3-dots Landscape menu touch area on the Driver Station, making it much easier to select.</li>
<li>Adds <code>terminateOpModeNow()</code> method to allow OpModes to cleanly self-exit immediately.</li>
<li>Adds <code>opModeInInit()</code> method to <code>LinearOpMode</code> to facilitate init-loops. Similar to <code>opModeIsActive()</code> but for the init phase.</li>
<li>Warns user if they have a Logitech F310 gamepad connected that is set to DirectInput mode.</li>
<li>Allows SPARKmini motor controllers to react more quickly to speed changes.</li>
<li>Hides the version number of incorrectly installed sister app (i.e. DS installed on RC device or vice-versa) on inspection screen.</li>
<li>Adds support for allowing the user to edit the comment for the runOpMode block.</li>
<li>Adds parameterDefaultValues field to @ExportToBlocks. This provides the ability for a java method with an @ExportToBlocks annotation to specify default values for method parameters when it is shown in the block editor.</li>
<li>Make LinearOpMode blocks more readable. The opmode name is displayed on the runOpMode block, but not on the other LinearOpMode blocks.</li>
<li>Added support to TensorFlow Object Detection for using a different frame generator, instead of Vuforia.
Using Vuforia to pass the camera frame to TFOD is still supported.</li>
<li>Removes usage of Renderscript.</li>
<li>Fixes logspam on app startup of repeated stacktraces relating to <code>"Failed resolution of: Landroid/net/wifi/p2p/WifiP2pManager$DeviceInfoListener"</code></li>
<li>Allows disabling bluetooth radio from inspection screen</li>
<li>Improves warning messages when I2C devices are not responding</li>
<li>Adds support for controlling the RGB LED present on PS4/Etpark gamepads from OpModes</li>
<li>Removes legacy Pushbot references from OpMode samples.  Renames "Pushbot" samples to "Robot".  Motor directions reversed to be compatible with "direct Drive" drive train.</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Bug fixes</h3><a id="user-content-bug-fixes-7" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Bug fixes" href="#bug-fixes-7"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Fixes <a href="https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/316" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController/issues/316/hovercard">issue #316</a> (MatrixF.inverted() returned an incorrectly-sized matrix for 1x1 and 2x2 matrixes).</li>
<li>Self inspect now allows for Driver Station and Robot Controller compatibility between point releases.</li>
<li>Fixes bug where if the same <code>RumbleEffect</code> object instance was queued for multiple gamepads, it
could happen that both rumble commands would be sent to just one gamepad.</li>
<li>Fixes bug in Driver Station where on the Driver Hub, if Advanced Gamepad Features was disabled and
an officially supported gamepad was connected, then opening the Advanced Gamepad Features or
Gamepad Type Overrides screens would cause the gamepad to be rebound by the custom USB driver even
though advanced gamepad features was disabled.</li>
<li>Protects against (unlikely) null pointer exception in Vuforia Localizer.</li>
<li>Harden OnBotJava and Blocks saves to protect against save issues when disconnecting from Program and Manage</li>
<li>Fixes issue where the RC app would hang if a REV Hub I2C write failed because the previous I2C
operation was still in progress. This hang most commonly occurred during REV 2M Distance Sensor initialization</li>
<li>Removes ConceptWebcam.java sample program.  This sample is not compatible with OnBotJava.</li>
<li>Fixes bug where using html tags in an @ExportToBlocks comment field prevented the blocks editor from loading.</li>
<li>Fixes blocks editor so it doesn't ask you to save when you haven't modified anything.</li>
<li>Fixes uploading a very large blocks project to offline blocks editor.</li>
<li>Fixes bug that caused blocks for DcMotorEx to be omitted from the blocks editor toolbox.</li>
<li>Fixes <a href="https://ftcforum.firstinspires.org/forum/ftc-technology/blocks-programming/87035-blocks-programs-stripped-of-blocks" rel="nofollow">Blocks Programs Stripped of Blocks (due to using TensorFlow Label block)</a></li>
</ul>
